gemBase.unit: SUOMENLINNA
SEAFORTRESS IN HELSINKI
The island fortress of Suomenlinna is one of Helsinki's most notable sights.
This unique architectural monument today serves a wide range of recreational and cultural functions and is still a thriving residential district as well.
At one time Suomenlinna, or Sveaborg as it was then called, was the greatest fortress in the Swedish empire.
Started in 1748, the fortification work involved six islands off the southern tip of Helsinki and was directed by Augustin Enrensvärd.
The flags of three different nations have flown over Suomenlinna's ramparts.
The fortress was Sweden's shield against the Russian Empire for 60 years until it surrendered to the enemy in 1808, during the War of Finland.
It was used by the Russians for the next 110 years.
In 1855, during the Crimean War, it was bombarded by a British Fleet.
After Finland had gained independence in 1917, the fortress was given its present name, which means "the fortress of Finland".
It continued to serve as a part of the nation's defences until 1973.
Suomenlinna's main tourist attraction is the fortifications on Susisaari and Kustaanmiekka islands, which now form a single island.
Kustaanmiekka is a small, well-preserved bastioned fort with concatenated defence walls and tunnels.
The island's foremost sight is the King's Gate.
The main fortress is located on Susisaari Island, which also includes a number of parks and squares.
This island's most important sight is the building complex and square around Ehrensvärd's tomb.

Guide services
The best way to find out about Suomenlinna is to take one of the guided tours offered daily.
Tours start from the information kiosk at Tykistölahti Bay and last about 1½ hours.
Your guide will point out places of interest on Susisaari and Kustaanmiekka islands and tell you about the history of the fortress.
From 1 June to 31 August, guided tours are offred in English at 12.30 and 2.30 pm daily.
Tickets are on sale at the information kiosk.
Groups may also book buides for other times, tel. 668 154.
Open 3---31 May daily 10 am-4 pm, 1 June ---30 Sept. 10 am-5 pm, 1 Oct. --- 30 Nov. Sat, Sun 11am-3 pm.
Ehrensvärd Museum
Historical museum on Susisaari Island.

unit.unit: It includes a model ship collection and officer's quarters
dating from the 18th century, as well as exhibitions detailing Suomenlinna's military past.

gemBase.unit: Armfelt Museum
Reconstruction of a 19th century upper-class home in a former barracks.
The museum includes five well-furnished rooms and a collection of china.
Model ship exhibition in the summer of 1986.
Open 12 May --- 31 August daily 11am-5.30 pm.
In September Sat-Sun only.

gemBase.unit: Walhalla Restaurant
Located on Kustaanmiekka Island, the Walhalla includes a first-class restaurant, cafeteria and pub.
A brick casemate dating from the 1750s serves as the dining-room, with bar and other facilities situated in granite casemates and around a reconstructed bastion.
Open 13 May --- 5 September.
The restaurant is open Mon --- Sat from 11.30 am to midnight, on Sundays 11.30 am-6 pm.
The terrace is open Mon---Sat 10 am--11 pm, on Sundays 10 am- 6pm.
